titleStmt.title: The Revd. Dr. S---- Answer to the Di-
stress'd Maids Petition,
Being a State of the Case, setting forth

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Ditto, In Imitation of Frances Harris's Petition.
MADAM,
WHEREAS you were never Marry'd, tho' come to the Years of Five and twenty,
Being Co-Heiress to an Estate of 800 l. per Annum, Nemine Contradicente,
Which said Estate is somewhat Incumber'd, as you have hinted,
And briefly set forth in your Petition, lately printed.
And now Whereas you are well-disposed and willing to Make- over
Your Body and Estate, to the said certain C────k, your Lover;
As he also on the other hand, with his Body and Purse,
Is satisfy'd to take with you, for better or worse,, during all the Days of his Life,
To Have and to Hold
(Notwithstanding any thing to the contrary) as his lawful Wife
But Whereas, in case that you shou'd happen to Marry
Without your Mother's Consent, you are likely to Miscarry;
And Whereas, tho' at First, it was her Good-will and and Pleasure,
That you should Marry the aforesaid C────k, on account of his Treasure;
She now seemeth Therein altogether unwilling,
And Vows, If you do it, to cut you off with a Shilling: of the said Defendant, you may depend on't;Wherefore as far as I have hitherto taken Notice,
All which Actings and Doings
Are contrary to Equity and Law
And as I humbly Conceive, in Verbum Sacerdotis,
That the said Defendant may be brought fairly to Answer ye,
The only way you have, is to File a BILL in ChanceryAnd to the End that you and the C────k may have a Release,
According to the Nature and Circumstances of the Case.
Pray a Subpaena to Answer against the Defendant's Clause,
That She be obliged to shew good and sufficient Cause, She, contrary to her former Compunction,Refuses to Consent to the Match; and pray an Injunction,
Wherefore
Directed to the Sheriffs of the City of Dublin quickly;
Another to the Sheriff of the County of Wicklow,
The One, in order to put the aforesaid P────f────g Noddy,In Possession of your Estate, and the Other, in Possession of your Body.
